intro: Reseda villosa, commonly known as hairy reseda, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes plants like mustard and cabbage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, yellow flowers in clusters. Its leaves are hairy and have a distinctive, aromatic scent. Reseda villosa is often found in disturbed soils and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value.
